name: Andaz Wall Street

reviews.text: Booked this through a 3rd party site...rate was high, but I thought well worth it. There were 3 adults (myself, husband, and our 21 year old son). Stayed Sat night. Drove from Boston, and not having been to NY for many years, wasn't sure staying in FiDi was the best idea, but it was. Room was ready when we arrived at noon, so we were able to freshen up, don our sneakers, and get walking! Room was spacious enough, only complaint is the bathroom lighting is dim. Beds a bit hard, but just fine. The area is quiet on a Sat/Sun, but we liked that. Never heard a thing, although the reality is, we weren't in the room a lot! Staff VERY helpful and pleasant. Parked the car next door at Imperial Parking, rate is $34/day. Subway short walk, so very easy to get anywhere from here. Breakfast is a bit pricey, but was delicious. I am very happy we didn't stay in Times Square, as many recommended in order to be closer to the "action". The action wasn't as appealing to me as the quiet sanctuary needed after a long day of sightseeing and walking! Would surely stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay for Father's day weekend

reviews.text: I just stayed at Andaz Wall St for a second stay over the weekend & had a great time! The super friendly young girl who checked me in gave me a lovely upgrade to a Large Andaz King room, which had the added benefit of of soaking tub, which was great! I really love this hotel- the cool, sleek lines & extremely spacious rooms with high ceilings are really amazing & add a very cool loft like feel to the rooms- if you are a fan of clean, modern design, you will love this place!
reviews.title: 2nd visit was perfect!
Best of the Andaz properties!
reviews.text: I was on the 11th floor, # 1108, & while my room faced the street, it was extremely quiet & peaceful- the A/C was cold & worked well, the pillows & bed are lovely- really soft sheets that are blissful, the CO Bigelow shampoo & body was smell clean & slightly citrus like, the modern rug in the room is super soft & the complimentary bottled still water, Gluten Free Chips & Sprite in the mini-bar are an awesome touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered In-Room Dining twice (Dinner + Breakfast)- each arrived on time & everything was really delicious, including an amazing Caesar Salad with perfectly grilled chicken, the best dressing & fresh parmesan + homemade vanilla ice cream that was incredible & Waffle with really good syrup + an amazing glass of Freshly pressed orange juice that tasted so fresh!
reviews.title: Enjoyed it much!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to returning again for another visit!
reviews.title: My hotel in NY !

reviews.text: This was my second stay. Room 1606, a large king with walk-in shower. The check-in was easy and friendly. I was upgraded from standard king. After dinner my first evening, I was surprised to come back to a bottle of wine in my room with a nice note (for no reason – making it an even nicer gesture). Ordered room service all three days – it was quick, with one small hiccup that was quickly rectified. Dined in the restaurant – good but not great. Had a night cap in the bar. The area is not central, but I like it quiet at night. The Wall Street subway is close by and a quick walk gets you to South Ferry stop. I do wish they’d bring back the free coffee in the lobby. And the bathroom lighting is still way too dark for a lady who needs to see what she actually looks like in daylight. All staff were friendly and helpful. There is no one stationed at door to help with bags or get you a taxi – but there are frequently cabs out front. 24-hr Duane Reade (drug store) across the street. An easy walk to Century 21, Tribeca and Ground Zero.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great service, well priced for NYC

reviews.text: This is the first time I've stayed in an Andaz, and it isn't clear to me how Hyatt is placing this brand. The hotel felt quite similar to the excellent "park" Hyatt line, but not quite up to the excellent expectations I've had for that brand (here I am praising with faint damnation).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The room was very attractive, large and well appointed,though just very slightly worn-looking, Staff were very helpful an friendly. Restaurant had a fairly small menu, but the food was excellent at very reasonable prices for this sort of establishment.
reviews.title: Nice property

reviews.text: The hotel is in a convenient location on wall street, and not far from a subway stop. They do play funny games with the floor numbers - with quite a few missing floors the rooms are much lower than the "floor numbers" would suggest, and at least from my room there was a very limited view. (I can't tell if the top floors have views over the harbor - if so, they would be spectacular).
reviews.title: Andaz weekend stay

reviews.text: Overall a very nice high end hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous Boutique

reviews.text: Check in was personal, fast, and full of great local tips. We were a few hours early but our room was ready and we had a nice view of the water from the side of the window. The entire property was very stylish and clean. We paid a very fair price for Manhattan standards and the freebies made for an even better value. The location was great and the sushi restaurant across the street was a favorite. There was also a string of little bars and restaurants a bit further down which we did not have time to try, but they looked good.
reviews.title: Love, love, LOVE this place

reviews.text: All staff that we encountered were above and beyond wonderful. We also enjoyed the elevators in the main lobby. One was always automatically open and waiting for the trip up to the room.
reviews.title: Value for Money
Clean, modern, stylish hotel with competent staff and nice freebies
reviews.text: We were not able to make the complimentary wine reception, but we did have a glass at the bar. Very trendy and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When traveling to NYC in the future, we will definitely stay here again...without shopping around for other options.
reviews.title: Cool, stylish and free wine !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I spent a few days here this week and loved it. The staff went out of their way to help us with everything, from recommending restaurants in the neighborhood to providing directions to getting us gypsy cabs. It is very clean, modern, stylish, and spacious, and the free minibar (except for alcohol), complimentary coffee/fresh orange juice in the morning, and free happy hour in the lobby were great perks. I highly recommend this place, given its excellent location and price relative to its peers in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: NYC stop over--unplugged

reviews.text: Stayed in room #1407 for three nights. King bed, large room and bathroom for the city. The hotel’s design is on the stark side. I generally don’t like design hotels b/c they look cool but are rarely functional (the cooler the shower looks the more it leaks) – and there’s usually an air of snob. The Andaz is different – it’s a really good hybrid of chic and friendly. I was met immediately when I arrived – no real check-in desk, just a bunch of folks w. iPads. I was offered a drink and quickly checked in. Room 1407 is spacious. No view to speak of – but quiet and calm. The bed was good – a little firm, more along the lines of a European hotel bed than American. Great bedding and pillows. Lots of plugs for gadgets. There’s a full-length mirror – it pulls out from wall beside mini-fridge area. Small closet. Blackout shades to assure privacy and good sleep quality. Flat screen TV w. lots of channels – but most of the time I was there the satellite was iffy. Had three room service breakfasts – good food and fast service. I asked for a NY Times and rec’d gratis. Duane Reade (drug store) across the street.
reviews.title: Cool hotel, good staff, nice amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I really didn’t like about the room was poor lighting. It’s much too dark in the bathroom and area by the closet mirror. I dragged a freestanding lamp in to help but it was still much too dark. A lady needs her light to primp.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The 1 & 2 lines are very close. Short walk to stock market, Trinity church, Century 21, South St. Seaport and Century 21. Wall St. is much livelier after hours than it used to be – but it’s still pretty quiet at night.
reviews.title: Good hotel for business travellers

reviews.text: Ate in the formal restaurant – very good food and service. Also had drinks and food at the bar. Good drink and the crab cake – while minute – was yummy.
reviews.title: Trendy and Spartan and Comfortable

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Capital A mazing!!!

reviews.text: Andaz appears to be Hyatt's answer to the W. Modern, uber cool, low lights, etc. There are only 7 of them now so you'll have to be in one of a few places (NY, California, London, soon Amsterdam) to try them out. Check-in is a very practiced casual experience. The associate checking you in chats you up, takes you to your room and is generally very welcoming. The rooms here are huge and the bathrooms even huger - a rarity in NYC. The shower in the bath is a giant area with nice rain style shower heads complemented by a hand held spray. Amenities are first rate. The bed was comfy with a choice of foam and feather pillows.
reviews.title: Very, very nice - highly recommended.

reviews.text: The room is high tech with master control switches for blinds, lights, etc. WiFi is free as are, unexpectedly, all nonalcoholic items in the minibar. There are lots of plugs at the desk for recharging your various devices and a sound system so cool I could hardly figure it out it. There is an evening happy hour, 24 hour coffee, a pleasant snacky sort of breakfast array and a sophisticated but casual vibe to the public areas.
reviews.title: Please can I stay again?

reviews.text: Views are not much on most sides of the hotel as you are underneath a condo development that got the good views. And the low lighting is a challenge for those of us with aging eyes that require bi-focals to see tiny switches and not-well-lit temperature controls.
reviews.title: Over-rated!

reviews.text: Overall I have to say this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in NY (Trump SoHo is the best) and I got it for a song via Hotwire.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, curtious staff - great room, Andaz a new favourite of mine mine on based on this performance? The greeting team were particularly friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Another great NYC Hyatt

reviews.text: Booked following reviews read on Trip Advisor and what a great hotel. Stayed for 4 nights on vacation.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for NY

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Andaz; Clean & Classy!

reviews.text: Room size
reviews.title: Great Stay Good Location

reviews.text: Shower (big enough to take all 4 of us)
reviews.title: Best

reviews.text: Bed
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: After landing and checking in at The Andaz at 8am, I was greeted with overall satisfication. I was really tired from a 5 hour flight from Sacramento CA and the only thing I wanted to do was have a bite to eat, shower, & take a nice long nap. To my surprise, I had that in no less then 30 minutes. My room was ready, breakfast was there and the shower was in pristine condition. The staff was on it. Customer service was A grade and I couldn't ask for more. I had a nice New York City view and met some of the nicest people New York City could offer. The bar & lounge area was indescribable with a touch of class. The thing that stood out most was the energy of management & staff. They made my stay uplifting and definitely worthwhile. Next time your in NYC do yourself a favor and visit this lovely boutique hotel. Wether its business or pleasure, you're in for a treat. -DJRatedR
reviews.title: Excellent Staff & Management service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was super modern and spacious. The minibar was free. We really enjoyed staying here. On Saturday there was a brunch until 2pm instead of normal breakfast, which was nice as we didnt want to get up so early. That was honestly the best breakfast/brunch I ever had in the US! Sooo many choices and sooo delicious!!
reviews.title: Super modern room and best breakfast!

reviews.text: The location is best if you are on a business trip, because you are in the middle of the finance sector BUT we were here only for holiday and it was not stressful at all to reach the main tourist spots in manhattan, the subway is really fast and there are 2 stations just around the corner of the Andaz. Compared to other New York Hotels it is very quite at night.
reviews.title: Suite place to stay NYC style

reviews.text: This is a great place. Stayed in a double and it felt like a suite for New York City. Have stayed other places in New York and they have been Cracker Jack rooms. Would stay again. Also is a great location to and from accessible to subway station.
reviews.title: good but never again
An enjoyable experience
reviews.text: Stayed here from May 6th till May 11th, I would like to say the hotel is without any hesitation a 5 star hotel. But I have some remarks:

reviews.title: Great experience from top to bottom.
reviews.text: We booked the Andax for six nights as part of the first leg of our trip around the North East USA. The basic room rates fit our budget but I decided to upgrade to a larger room.

Firstly the location: the Andaz is on Wall Street which means a travel time of around twenty minutes to Times Square. This was perfect for us as we wanted somewhere quieter, and at night the area around the hotel is alive but not over the top busy. The Wall Street subway station is less than five minutes walk from the hotel and that can take you uptown or to Brooklyn. We caught a fight at the Barclays Center and it was ten minutes travel from there to Wall Street. There's lots of things nearby that we enjoyed, but you don't have to fight the crowds.
reviews.title: Great stay for Girlie Trip
Fancy hotel
reviews.text: The hotel experience was really good right from the word go, the check-in took two minutes (and check out was even quicker). I liked this as most hotels I stay in have a sometimes-painful welcome, or goodbye, process. We stayed on the eighth floor, which was one of the lower floors in the hotel, but had no real noise issues. The room was a corner suite which meant we had round seven hundred square feet to play with, a large double bed and a nice sitting area. All the lighting is dim-able and controlled by buttons around the room, and there are electric blinds that close to give you almost complete darkness.

We only breakfastested once in the hotel but it was great (we'd budgeted for this breakfast, it's a bit more than a Starbucks). The pancakes were nice, coffee was one of the nicest on our trip and I also had the continental option of fruit and pastries.
reviews.title: Consistently a pleasure, over almost a month's stay

reviews.text: The gym is small but the equipment is good, I used it every morning and found that after 8am was the quietest time. There's four running machines that are pretty high spec, some free weights and other machines that I didn't use. Newspapers, bottled water and towels are provided, which was a nice touch (I'm from the UK so the gyms here usually don't provide these).
reviews.title: Stay away - under staffed and often dirty hotel

description: Experience Lower Manhattan’s renaissance at Andaz Wall Street from Hyatt. Have a seat in the Andaz Lounge—an open, communal setting that’s equal parts living room and lobby—where your Andaz Host will warmly greet you and check you in with a handheld iPad. Complimentary High-speed wireless Internet and local calls will be make you right at home as well as free non-alcoholic beverages and snacks. Escape from the real world with high-impact treatments from The SPA or enjoy a quick stroll to South Street Seaport. It’s your call — you’re in the heart of it all.
